meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a burglar.
meanings.sent1: He moved burglariously through the dark alley, trying to avoid being seen.
meanings.sent2: The thief entered the house burglariously through the window.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon snuck burglariously into the trash can, looking for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: The shadows danced burglariously across the walls as the intruder made his way inside.
meanings.sent5: The cat crept burglariously towards the unsuspecting bird, ready to pounce.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves burglary.
meanings.sent1: The stolen goods were hidden burglariously in the abandoned warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The criminals planned to break into the bank burglariously under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids pretended to be burglars and acted burglariously in their game of make-believe.
meanings.sent4: The secrets were taken burglariously from the secure database, leaving no trace behind.
meanings.sent5: The night air was filled with tension as the thieves worked burglariously to crack the safe.
